title: Decimal amounts not converted to fractions
description:
~1100+ fixtures have amounts like '0.5', '0.75', '1.5' that could be displayed as '1/2', '3/4', '1 1/2' for readability. This is a presentation choice - current behavior isn't wrong, just less idiomatic for recipes. Would need a conversion function for common decimals. Low priority.

See doc/ingredient-parsing.md for workflow and file locations.

title: Non-ingredient/equipment lines leaking into ingredient lists
description:
Spotty but recurring issue where equipment/non-ingredient lines end up in ingredient lists. Examples: 'A 12-cup Bundt pan, a pastry bag, and a large star tip', '9x13 metal baking pans or large roasting pan lined with foil', 'Burger accompaniments, as you like'. Should be filtered upstream or flagged as section headers.

See doc/ingredient-parsing.md for workflow and file locations.

title: Comma-separated conditional quantities
description:
~2 fixtures (paprika) have lines with multiple quantities for different use cases, like '4 cups vegetable broth (for dried but soaked chickpeas), 1 1/2 cups vegetable broth (for cooked chickpeas)'. Currently only the first measurement is extracted; the second alternative ends up in the item field. Tricky because comma normally separates item from prep notes. May need special handling for patterns where text after comma starts with a number+unit.

See doc/ingredient-parsing.md for workflow and file locations.

title: Orphaned prep words without ingredient
description:
~11 lines are single prep words with no ingredient: 'sliced', 'cooked', 'shredded', 'peeled', 'dried', 'toasted', etc. These are orphaned from upstream extraction where the ingredient got separated. Parser could filter out single-word prep terms.

See doc/ingredient-parsing.md for workflow and file locations.

title: Footnote asterisks in item names
description:
~7 fixtures have items like 'cherry tomatoes*' where the asterisk is a footnote marker. Low impact and potentially risky to strip (what if someone writes 'brand*name'?). Probably acceptable to leave as-is.

See doc/ingredient-parsing.md for workflow and file locations.

title: Concatenated ingredient lines
description:
Unknown count of cases where multiple ingredients end up on one line like '3/4 cup (180ml) milk 1/4 cup (60ml) vegetable oil'. This is an extraction bug upstream (ingredients should be on separate lines), not a parser bug. The parser can't reasonably split these without risking false positives.

See doc/ingredient-parsing.md for workflow and file locations.

title: More X garnish/addition lines
description:
~15 lines start with 'More' followed by an ingredient: 'More parsley', 'More chopped chives', 'More beansprouts'. These are typically garnish additions. Could strip 'More ' prefix or mark ingredient as optional.

See doc/ingredient-parsing.md for workflow and file locations.

title: Missing space between number and text
description:
~6 lines have numbers immediately followed by text with no space: '1finely chopped green chile', '450gpowdered sugar', '6x6-inch spring roll wrappers'. The parser could insert a space when a digit is immediately followed by a letter.

See doc/ingredient-parsing.md for workflow and file locations.

title: Placeholder text TK/TODO
description:
~2 lines contain placeholder text from unfinished recipes: '(TK g) panko bread crumbs' and 'stock (TODO)'. TK is journalism shorthand for 'to come'. These are upstream data quality issues.

See doc/ingredient-parsing.md for workflow and file locations.

title: to NUMBER range orphans
description:
~30 lines start with 'to' followed by a number: 'to 1 cup water', 'to 1 1/2 cups'. These are the second half of 'X to Y' range patterns where the first part got separated upstream. Cannot recover the missing first value.

See doc/ingredient-parsing.md for workflow and file locations.

title: Non-quantity leading parentheticals
description:
~27 lines have leading parentheticals that aren't quantities: '(laung)', '(about) parsley', '(reserved) bacon grease', '(thin red onion slices)'. Previous fix handled quantity parens like '(half stick)', but these non-quantity parens need different handling - some should become notes, some stripped.

See doc/ingredient-parsing.md for workflow and file locations.

title: Orphaned hyphenated units from range splits
description:
~18 lines start with hyphenated units: '-ounce can chickpeas', '-inch piece ginger', '-pound ground beef'. These came from patterns like '14-ounce can' where the leading number got separated during upstream extraction. Cannot be fixed by parser since the number is lost.

See doc/ingredient-parsing.md for workflow and file locations.

title: Single-word colon section headers
description:
~32 lines are single-word section headers ending with colon: 'Brine:', 'Dough:', 'Caramel:', 'Eggs:', 'Filling:', etc. These should be detected as section headers via the 'Word:' pattern.

See doc/ingredient-parsing.md for workflow and file locations.

title: Leading - list marker before amounts
description:
~13 lines start with '- ' followed by a number, like '- 2 cups flour' or '- 3 tablespoons ice water'. These appear to be markdown/HTML list bullets that leaked through extraction. The parser could strip leading '- ' when followed by a digit.

See doc/ingredient-parsing.md for workflow and file locations.

title: Leading & or + continuation symbols
description:
~62 lines start with '& ' or '+ ' followed by fractions/amounts, like '& 1/2 cups flour' or '+ 1 tablespoon sugar'. These are orphaned continuations from split 'X & Y' or 'X + Y' amounts. The parser could strip these leading symbols to parse the remaining amount correctly. Related to but distinct from the 'and/or/plus' word issue (ramekin-5b8).

See doc/ingredient-parsing.md for workflow and file locations.

title: Orphaned x multiplier
description:
~8 lines start with 'x' followed by a quantity: 'x 14 ounce cans', 'x 400g cans', 'x packs shortcrust pastry'. These are multiplier patterns where the leading number (e.g., '2') got separated upstream.

See doc/ingredient-parsing.md for workflow and file locations.

title: Optional: prefix lines
description:
~16 lines start with 'Optional:' or 'Optional -' followed by ingredients: 'Optional: 1/4 cup cocoa powder', 'Optional - 1/2 cup dry white wine'. Could extract 'Optional' as a note and parse the rest normally.

See doc/ingredient-parsing.md for workflow and file locations.

title: Trailing semicolon in items
description:
~3 fixtures (kingarthurbaking) have semicolons used as separators sticking to item names, e.g., item='Parmesan cheese, grated;'. Low impact.

See doc/ingredient-parsing.md for workflow and file locations.

title: Orphaned each X quantity splits
description:
~4 lines start with 'each' followed by ingredients: 'each salt and pepper', 'each garlic and onion powder'. These are missing their quantity (e.g., '1 tsp each'). Could recognize 'each' as a quantity indicator.

See doc/ingredient-parsing.md for workflow and file locations.

title: ALL CAPS single-word section headers
description:
~17 lines are ALL CAPS single words that are section headers: 'ASSEMBLY', 'FILLING', 'FROSTING', 'DOUGH', 'BRAISE', 'CRUST', etc. These should be detected as section headers and filtered or converted to section metadata.

See doc/ingredient-parsing.md for workflow and file locations.

title: of X phrase orphans
description:
~19 lines start with 'of' followed by a noun: 'of a lemon', 'of a medium onion', 'of a red or white onion'. These are fragments from phrases like 'juice of a lemon' or 'zest of a medium onion' where the first part got separated upstream.

See doc/ingredient-parsing.md for workflow and file locations.
